snippet: Ed Miliband, the leader of the Labour Party, reduced the prospects of Britain leaving the 28-nation European Union in the next few years.
abstract: Ed Miliband, leader of Britain's opposition Labour Party, says that he will almost certainly not hold a quick referendum on the country's membership in the European Union if his party wins power in 2015; comments reduce prospect of Britain quitting the European Union in the next few years.
lead_paragraph: Ed Miliband, the leader of the Labour Party, reduced the prospects of Britain leaving the 28-nation European Union in the next few years.

headline.main: British Opposition Leader Cool to Quick Vote on E.U. Membership
headline.print_headline: Britain: Opposition Leader Promises No Quick Vote on European Union
